Room.Name: A Dusty Trail to the Inn
Room.Description: This small dirt path leads from the forest to a clearing, in that clearing is the Valley Inn. The trees seem to arch over the path, giving it a soft aura of light and a yet a cool, refreshing shade. The path leads through the forest to the Valley Inn.

Room.Name: A Dusty Trail to the Inn
Room.Description: This small dirt path leads from the forest to a clearing, in that clearing is the Valley Inn. The trees seem to arch over the path, giving it a soft aura of light and a yet a cool, refreshing shade. The path leads through the forest to the Valley Inn.

Room.Name: A Dusty Trail to the Inn
Room.Description: The small dusty trail bends to the north; from here you can see the Valley Inn. The trail continues just a few more feets then stops at the clearing.

Room.Name: A Dusty Trail to the Inn
Room.Description: The small trail ends here as, to the north is the Valley Inn. The forest around you is light and well kept to attract visitors and travelers to the inn. The inn lies north, the trail exits south.

Room.Name: Entrance to the Inn
Room.Description: You stand before a set of double-doors leading into the Valley Inn. The porch leads around the inn; the doors allow you to enter north. The entire building is made of wood. The inn is quite large, its second level allowing guests private rooms and the lower level for the bar and entertainment. A small sign is posted on the left door.

ExtraDescription.Description: Welcome to the Valley Inn, please enjoy yourself and follow the rules: * Please keep peaceful in the inn, violence will not be tolerated so please restrain from criminal acts. * You are expected to pay for anything to eat, or drink. And remember, friends don't let friends drive drunk. * We do serve criminals but we reserve the right to ask you to leave if you attracted fights with Enforcers. * Please stay visible in the inn unless are you hiding from attack or a thief. * This is a place to enjoy yourself, have fun! -- Thank you, Celeborn, Muse of the Valley

Room.Name: A crowded room
Room.Description: This large area is full of tables and chairs and happy people. All of the furnishings are made of polished oak. All around people sit and enjoy their drinks. The inn has many bouncers who roam the inn looking for bums wishing to start fights. To the east is the fireplace and west a small library. The tables continues north nearing the bar.

Room.Name: A crowded room
Room.Description: This area is even more crowded than before. Tables and chairs are packed end to end. To the north is the large bar, serving all kinds of drinks. To the east is the stage; to the west is the dance floor. The bar lies to the north.

Room.Name: The Bar
Room.Description: The Valley Inns bar is like nothing else. Behind the bar stands a rugged dwarf serving drinks from all across Orthos. The bar is made of solid oak with a gold railing. Maple stools line the bar, topped with velvet seats. All around you hear jolly music and the sounds of good times and fond memories. To the west is the dance floor; east lies a door leading to the backstage area.

Room.Name: The Fireplace
Room.Description: This small corner of the inn is probably the only place you'll find a bit of tranquility. The sounds from the back round are blocked out by the soft crackle of the fire. Two large velvet lines couches are set in a V shape in front of the fireplace. This is the perfect place to rest without taking a room. To the north is stage; the tables are to the west. There is a small stairway leading upstairs.

Room.Name: The Stage
Room.Description: This large stage is set a few feet above the floor level. Ahead of you are the royal blue curtains, drooping down from above. The stage is well lit and always clean, ready for the Inns entertainment or any traveler who has a song to sing or tale to well. To the west are more crowded tables, south the fireplace. The back stage area is north.

Room.Name: A Small Library
Room.Description: .This quaint and cozy little corner of the Inn contains a small library, dedicated to many short stories, legends and histories of the heroes of Othos. A large bookcase is set against the western wall. Several comfortable chairs and small tables have been strategically placed around the room, offering a comfortable place to read.

Room.Name: The Dance Floor
Room.Description: The dance floor is often crowded with people looking to have a good time. The first thing you notice is that the different people dance in different styles. Elves and Dwarves dancing together, even a drow and giant of the storms. Table crowded with people are east; to the south lies the small library. The dance floor contines to the north.

Room.Name: The Dance Floor
Room.Description: This half of the dance floor is less crowded, here a few more drunks gather to keep keen eyes of the woman at the bar. The floor is made of solid oak, shining like it was just cleaned. Near the corner on the western wall is a small window. To the south the dance floor continues; east is the bar.

Room.Name: Back Stage
Room.Description: This small are is cluttered with robes and pullies, which control the stages trap doors and curtains. Many props are scattered around, along with costumes and masks. The stage lies to the south; the bar is west.

Room.Name: The Porch
Room.Description: This narrow wooden porch is a place to get away from the festivities or just a place to rest. The porch bends around the inn and ends at each side of the back. A long oak raiding keeps people safe. Above you can see the overhang of the second level of the Valley Inn. The porch continues around the Inn.

Room.Name: The Porch
Room.Description: This narrow wooden porch is a place to get away from the festivities or just a place to rest. The porch bends around the inn and ends at each side of the back. A long oak raiding keeps people safe. Above you can see the overhang of the second level of the Valley Inn. The porch continues around the Inn.

Room.Name: The Porch
Room.Description: This narrow wooden porch is a place to get away from the festivities or just a place to rest. The porch bends around the inn and ends at each side of the back. A long oak raiding keeps people safe. Above you can see the overhang of the second level of the Valley Inn. The porch continues around the Inn.

Room.Name: The Porch
Room.Description: This narrow wooden porch is a place to get away from the festivities or just a place to rest. The porch bends around the inn and ends at each side of the back. A long oak raiding keeps people safe. Above you can see the overhang of the second level of the Valley Inn. The porch continues around the Inn.

Room.Name: The Porch
Room.Description: This narrow wooden porch is a place to get away from the festivities or just a place to rest. The porch bends around the inn and ends at each side of the back. A long oak raiding keeps people safe. Above you can see the overhang of the second level of the Valley Inn. The porch continues around the Inn.

Room.Name: The Porch
Room.Description: This narrow wooden porch is a place to get away from the festivities or just a place to rest. The porch bends around the inn and ends at each side of the back. A long oak raiding keeps people safe. Above you can see the overhang of the second level of the Valley Inn. The porch continues around the Inn.

Room.Name: The Porch
Room.Description: This narrow wooden porch is a place to get away from the festivities or just a place to rest. The porch bends around the inn and ends at each side of the back. A long oak raiding keeps people safe. Above you can see the overhang of the second level of the Valley Inn. The porch continues around the Inn.

Room.Name: The Porch
Room.Description: This narrow wooden porch is a place to get away from the festivities or just a place to rest. The porch bends around the inn and ends at each side of the back. A long oak raiding keeps people safe. Above you can see the overhang of the second level of the Valley Inn. The porch continues around the Inn.

Room.Name: The Porch
Room.Description: This narrow wooden porch is a place to get away from the festivities or just a place to rest. The porch bends around the inn and ends at each side of the back. A long oak raiding keeps people safe. Above you can see the overhang of the second level of the Valley Inn. The porch continues around the Inn.

Room.Name: The Porch
Room.Description: This narrow wooden porch is a place to get away from the festivities or just a place to rest. The porch bends around the inn and ends at each side of the back. A long oak raiding keeps people safe. Above you can see the overhang of the second level of the Valley Inn. The porch continues around the Inn.

Room.Name: A Hallway
Room.Description: This narrow hallway leads through the upper level of the Valley Inn. The light of the windows on the eastern wall lights the hallway. A small sign is posted for all to read. The hallway continues north; the stairs lead to the lower level.

ExtraDescription.Description: This narrow hallway leads through the upper level of the Valley Inn. The light of the windows on the eastern wall lights the hallway. A small sign is posted for all to read. The hallway continues north; the stairs lead to the lower level.

Room.Name: A Hallway
Room.Description: The Hallway continues, leading north and south. Portraits and paintings of Orthoss greatest musicians and jesters line the western wall. The light from the windows shines upon the western wall. To the north the hallway bends west; the hallway continues south as well.

Room.Name: The Hallway
Room.Description: Here the hallway bends to the west. From here on to the west a long velvet carpet lines the floor. The hallway continues west, towards a large open room.

Room.Name: The hallway
Room.Description: The long hallway continues to extend east and west. The windows on the northern wall seem to brighten everything up. The walls are lined with portraits and paintings. The Hallway continues east and west.

Room.Name: Before the Hall of Music
Room.Description: The hallway widens here, as it becomes more of an entry hall. To the north and south are four chairs on each side. West is a massive door leading to the hall of music. The hall of music is here for only the practice and admission of the Muses of the valley. The hallway continues east; to the west lies the hall of Music.

Room.Name: The Hall of Music
Room.Description: This massive hall is decorated with the finish of materials. The walls are papered with fine prints and covered in great tapestries. One massive chandelier lights the entire room. On the northern wall is a small stage, before it are two rows of benches. On the western wall is a rack of instruments, being sold by a jolly elf. The walls are lined with massive stain-glass windows letting in light of different colors. This room is truly magical and inspiring.

Room.Name: A Dusty Trail Around the Inn
Room.Description: The small, dusty trail leads around the Inn and breaks north, heading into what appears to be a tiny woodland village. On the hills beyond that, a foreboding and darkened forest lies to the north. To the south and west, you can see a major highway bustling with wagon caravans.

Room.Name: A Dusty Trail Around the Inn
Room.Description: The small, dusty trail leads around the Inn and breaks north, heading into what appears to be a tiny woodland village. On the hills beyond that, a foreboding and darkened forest lies to the north. To the south and west, you can see a major highway bustling with wagon caravans.

Room.Name: Trail Behind the Hut
Room.Description: The small, dusty trail leads around the Inn and breaks north, heading into what appears to be a tiny woodland village. On the hills beyond that, a foreboding and darkened forest lies to the north. To the south and west, you can see a major highway bustling with wagon caravans.

NPC.name: human bouncer
NPC.description: This strong man is dressed in simple cloths making him look like a normal citizen.
NPC.longDescription: A large man stands here keeping a keen eye out for trouble.

NPC.name: giant bouncer
NPC.description: This brute fellow stands perfectly still, his yes following everyone who enters the area.
NPC.longDescription: A massive giant stands here eyeing the bar for drunks and trouble makers.

NPC.name: baldur bar bartender
NPC.description: Baldur is a stubby man, short and fat. The only thing this old dwarf knows is drinks, and good ones!
NPC.longDescription: Baldur the bartender stands behind the bar ready to serve you.
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel StayArea Warrior UpdateAlways Shopkeeper

NPC.name: old man
NPC.description: This old man is dressed in rags, obviously poor as fuck.. Thats why he is out here, alone.
NPC.longDescription: An old man huddles over the porch railing, looking at the sky.

NPC.name: elf storyteller
NPC.description: This small elf is dressed in fine cloths, those of a jester. A shiney silver pocketwatch hangs out of his pocket, attracting the eyes of theives.
NPC.longDescription: A small elf stands here telling his tales to anyone who will listen.

NPC.name: small fox
NPC.description: This small fox has dark, fuzzy grey hair striped with black. His dark blue eyes show little care for you or anyone else, just tiredness.
NPC.longDescription: A small fox is curled in on the floor.

NPC.name: human man sam
NPC.description: This tall man is dressed in red suspenders and wears dark black glasses. His namtag says "Sam the Silly"
NPC.longDescription: A tall man stands here looking over the bookshelf.

NPC.name: elf elven singer
NPC.description: This small elf is dressed in fine royal cloths, singing his heart out.
NPC.longDescription: A beautiful elf stands here singing proudly.

NPC.name: short woman
NPC.description: This lovely woman is dressed in a fine ball gown. Her long blond hair falls to her shoulders, swaying as she twirls around.
NPC.longDescription: A short woman stands here dancing with a friend.

NPC.name: fat man
NPC.description: This man is quite fat and dressed in a black tux. His dark brown hair is cut jagged and unwashed.
NPC.longDescription: A rather fat man stands here dancing with a lovely girl.

NPC.name: strange man
NPC.description: This man is dressed in a suit of gems and gold, looking foolish!
NPC.longDescription: An oddly dressed man is here doing a strange dance.

NPC.name: dwarv dwarven worker
NPC.description: He is dressed in ragged cloths, he seems tired and annoyed.
NPC.longDescription: A dwarven stage worker is here preparing the stage for the band.

NPC.name: asmira instrumentalist
NPC.description: This file elven maiden is dressed in a perfect white dress. She hace a great figure and bright sky-blue eyes.
NPC.longDescription: Asmira, Instrumentalist of the Inn stands here selling her items.

NPC.name: small human muse chanter
NPC.longDescription: A tall human man known as the Valley Chanter stands here.
NPC.affectedBy: DetectInvis DetectHidden Sanctuary ProtectEvil ProtectionGood PassDoor Haste DarkVision DetectIllusion

NPC.name: cat cat-like man
NPC.description: This odd man is covered in golden brown fur, striped with white. His dark blue eyes are set softly into his skull. He purrs softly at you and smiles.
NPC.affectedBy: DetectInvis DetectHidden Sanctuary Sneak Haste DarkVision

Item.Name: mug dwarven ale
Item.LongDescription: A large mug filled with dark ale lies here.

Item.Name: glass tea elven ample
Item.ShortDescription: a glass of elven maple tea
Item.LongDescription: A small glass of tea lies here, steaming hot.

Item.Name: apple cider
Item.LongDescription: A jigger filled with apple cider lies here.

Item.Name: bottle old beer
Item.LongDescription: A crude bottle of old beer lies here.

Item.Name: firebreather
Item.ShortDescription: a jug of jack loukos firebreather
Item.LongDescription: A bottle of Jack Louko's Firebreather

Item.Name: a couch
Item.LongDescription: Two oak couches are set near the fireplace.

Item.Name: red suspenders
Item.LongDescription: A pair of crude red suspenders lay here.

Item.Name: ivory harp
Item.LongDescription: A fine ivory harp lies here, glinting with beauty.

Item.Name: black tux
Item.LongDescription: A black tux lays here covered in food stains.

Item.Name: white ball gown
Item.LongDescription: A wonderful white ball gown lies here.

Item.Name: silver flute
Item.LongDescription: A small silver flute lies here.

Item.Name: coral harp
Item.LongDescription: A large coral harp lies here.

Item.Name: brass horn
Item.LongDescription: A crude brass horn lies here.

Item.Name: large bookcase case bookshelf shelf
Item.LongDescription: A large mahogany bookshelf stands against the western wall.
Item.Description: Set against the western wall of the library is a bookcase fashioned of beautifully finished mahogany. Each shelf is filled with a row of neatly arranged, leather-bound books on every conceivable subject. Adjacent to the bookcase, there is a lectern with a single sheet of paper that reads 'index'.

Item.Name: lectern index card
Item.ShortDescription: a lectern holding a single index card
Item.LongDescription: A lectern holding a single index card sits next to the shelf.
Item.Description:
.List of available works:
A Fabrication of Creation - by Authenes Intimaedus III

Item.Name: fabrication creation authenes
Item.Description:
.A Fabrication of Creation - by Authenes Intimaedus III
PREFACE:
Inasmuch as any mortal has taken in hand the accounting of the most ancient among us and lived long enough to decipher the intricacies of such stories as are older than the tongues of men, I believe I have plucked the common thread. Of the elves, dwarves, giants and faeries, there is not a single fable which is favored above any others... but there is a name. In every language, it is the same name spoken.
It is a name which is only ever whispered. For some, in reverence. For others, in hushed fear. This writ, therefore, shall be my attempt to preserve the spirit and candor of this story which I have heard in so many verses, on the condition that you, my virtuous scholars, will continue this research into our world's most mysterious origins and with great due diligence.
CHAPTER ONE: The Dwarven Song of Orsi-tholos
For entertainment purposes, let us begin with the dwarves. They are not known for their scribes but their memory and their songs are as ancient as the mountains they call home.
'In the final beginning, there was only the Creator. His dawning aurora was scattered across the planes of existence.
He was the cold flame and the stone sea. A word unspoken. A light unseen.
Out of His thoughts, He created all things. And from His dreams, He created all beings. Some which would sing, while others could sting. All these things and beings, He gave unto them meaning.
So came the first day and night upon Orthos. So came the gods who were not gods. So came the spirit and the ghost, And the sun, moon and starry host.
So it was, when the Creator set all these things beneath the planes, that He cast the die and let them roll. The universe itself, His to control and the fates of mortals, cleft from His soul.'
